Detailed Description

Parser for advanced annotation mode. This parser augments the generated HTML in order to create mapping from HTML to the original wiki text on the client side.

Author:
Dian

Thomas Schweitzer

Definition at line 28 of file ExtendedParser.php.

Member Function Documentation

POMExtendedParser::checkIgnoreAnnotation ( &$  annotation  )  [private]

Checks if the content of an annotation (e.g. [[annotation]]) should be ignored for highlighting. This is used to define exceptions to the normal highlighting of internal wiki links.

Parameters:
string $annotation The annotation to examine.
Returns:
boolean <true>, if the annotation should be ignored <false>, otherwise

POMExtendedParser::doAddWTO ( &$  wikiText  )  [private]

Some wiki text should not be augmented with wiki text offsets. This method defines the exceptions.

Parameters:
string $wikiText The wiki text that will be examined
Returns:
boolean <true>, if the wiki text should be augmented with offsets <false> otherwise

POMExtendedParser::maskHTML ( &$  wikiText  )  [private]

The wiki text <$wikiText> may contain dangerous HTML code, <nowiki>-sections etc.that will confuse the parser that generates wiki text offsets (see addWikiTextOffsets). All dangerous text is replaced by * to keep the number of characters the same.

The following sections are handled:

  • HTML-comments ()
  • <nowiki>-sections
  • <noinclude>-sections
  • <ask>-sections
  • -sections

 
Parameters:

  

    
string $wikiText
 

  




Returns:
string masked wiki text

POMExtendedParser::Parse ( POMPage &$  page  ) 

Parses the text of a given page and creates an element structure. Supported types of elements include:

  • templates,
  • categories,
  • properties and
  • simple text
    which represent the rest.

Parameters:
POMPage &$page The page for which the POM will be built.

Reimplemented from POMParser.

Tries to parse a template.

Returns:

Definition at line 159 of file ExtendedParser.php.

Referenced by getParser().

POMExtendedParser::processTemplateToken ( &$  token,
$  currentlyParsing 
) [private]

Templates are parsed with a state machine. The parser is only interested in top level templates, however, they need to be parsed thoroughly to find their end correctly.

Parameters:
string $token The next piece of text to examine
Returns:
array(string,string) <null>, if the template parser is still collecting tokens or an array with three values: 0 - Type of result: t - start of template found at - abort current template candidate p - start of parameter found c - collecting tokens db - drop one opening brace a - append returned token to wiki text et - end of template found ep - end of parameter found 1 - Name of a template or <null> if no template was found 2 - the content of the template or the wiki text that was parsed or <null> if the parser is collecting tokens
